paper_abstract: We study the mechanism design version of the unrelated machines scheduling problem, which is at the core of Algorithmic Game Theory and was first proposed and studied in a seminal paper of Nisan and Ronen. We give an improved lower bound of 1+phi a parts per thousand 2.618 on the approximation ratio of deterministic truthful mechanisms for the makespan. The proof is based on a recursive preprocessing argument which yields a strictly increasing series of new lower bounds for each fixed number of machines na parts per thousand yen4.
paper_title: A Lower Bound of 1+phi for Truthful Scheduling Mechanisms
